info.title: Geocoder.ca
info.description: Geocoder.ca provides a simple XML interface to do real-time automated geocoding for your application.$

parameters.name: addresst
parameters.description: The name of the street address.	 A string no longer that 220 bytes.

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: Callback string if Output is in JSON format.	 Optionally you may request data in JSON format. The callback can be any string value.

parameters.name: city
parameters.description: The City Name	 A string no longer that 220 bytes.

parameters.name: decimal
parameters.description: An integer positive number.	 This is an optional parameter to limit the number of decimal places in the response. (note that a small number will reduce accuracy)

parameters.name: geoit
parameters.description: The output type desired.	 Only one allowed value: XML

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: optionally you can include your own transaction id. this will be returned along with the response if provided.	 a number or string no longer that 15 bytes.

parameters.name: jsonp
parameters.description: Output in JSON format.	 Optionally you may request data in JSON format. Accepted value: 1

parameters.name: locate
parameters.description: Optionally you can specify a location. for example 330 metcalfe ottawa or metcalfe & wellington ottawa	 This is an optional parameter for your convenience. We will parse out an address or intersection from it.

parameters.name: postal
parameters.description: A six letter canadian postal code	 The postal code format should follow the following format ANANAN where N represents a number and A a letter.

parameters.name: prov
parameters.description: The Two letter Canadian province code or US state abbreviation.	 (AB,BC,MB,NB,NL,NS,NT,NU,ON,PE,QC,SK,YT)

parameters.name: showpostal
parameters.description: Optionally - If you supply just a street address (or intersection), the showpostal parameter will instruct the algorithm to return the postal code of the location along with the latitude/longitude pair.	 Only one allowed value: 1

parameters.name: standard
parameters.description: Return the properly formated "standartized" address in the response.	 This is an optional parameter for address standardization. There is only one valid value: 1

parameters.name: strict
parameters.description: Optional Parameter for enabling strict parsing of free form location input.

parameters.name: strictmode
parameters.description: Optionally you can prevent geocoder from making guesses on your input - for example if you enter just a city name without the state or province, instead of geocoder determining the most likely city, it will let you chose from a list of suggestions.	 Allowed values are Integer 0 or 1.

parameters.name: topmatches
parameters.description: Optionally - If you supply a partial street address and wish to obtain a fixed number of the most likely suggestions, send a value through this parameter.	 This must be the maximum number of suggestions desired in the response. The topmatches parameter value must be a positive integer.

parameters.name: utm
parameters.description: Output latitude/longitude pair in The Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) geographic coordinate system.	 Optional. Accepted value: 1
